verses.verse: (For the choir director. A Psalm of David.) O God <WH430> of my praise, <WH8416> Do not be silent! <WH2790>
For they have opened <WH6605> the wicked <WH7563> and deceitful <WH4820> mouth <WH6310> against <WH5921> me; They have spoken <WH1696> against <WH854> me with a lying <WH8267> tongue. <WH3956>
They have also surrounded <WH5437> me with words <WH1697> of hatred, <WH8135> And fought <WH3898> against me without <WH2600> cause. <WH2600>
In return <WH8478> for my love <WH160> they act <WH7853> as my accusers; <WH7853> But I am [in] prayer. <WH8605>
Thus they have repaid <WH7760> me evil <WH9567> for good, <WH9186> And hatred <WH8135> for my love. <WH160>
Appoint <WH6485> a wicked <WH7563> man <WH7563> over <WH5921> him; And let an accuser <WH7854> stand <WH5975> at his right <WH3225> hand. <WH3225>
When he is judged, <WH8199> let him come <WH3318> forth <WH3318> guilty; <WH7563> And let his prayer <WH8605> become <WH1961> sin. <WH2401>
Let his days <WH3117> be few; <WH4592> Let another <WH312> take <WH3947> his office. <WH6486>
Let his children <WH1121> be fatherless, <WH3490> And his wife <WH802> a widow. <WH490>
Let his children <WH1121> wander <WH5128> about and beg; <WH7592> And let them seek <WH1875> [sustenance] far from their ruined <WH2723> homes. <WH2723>
Let the creditor <WH5383> seize <WH5367> all <WH3605> that he has; And let strangers <WH2114> plunder <WH962> the product <WH3018> of his labor. <WH3018>
Let there be none <WH408> to extend <WH4900> lovingkindness <WH2617> to him, Nor <WH408> any to be gracious <WH2603> to his fatherless <WH3490> children. <WH3490>
Let his posterity <WH319> be cut <WH3772> off; <WH3772> In a following <WH312> generation <WH1755> let their name <WH8034> be blotted <WH4229> out.
Let the iniquity <WH5771> of his fathers be remembered <WH1> before <WH2142> the Lord, <WH413> And do not let the sin <WH3068> of his mother <WH9128> be blotted <WH517> out.
Let them be before <WH5048> the Lord <WH3068> continually, <WH8548> That He may cut <WH3772> off <WH3772> their memory <WH2143> from the earth; <WH776>

Because <WH3282> he did not remember <WH2142> to show <WH6213> lovingkindness, <WH2617> But persecuted <WH7291> the afflicted <WH6041> and needy <WH34> man, <WH376> And the despondent <WH3512> in heart, <WH3824> to put <WH4191> [them] to death. <WH4191>
He also loved <WH157> cursing, <WH7045> so it came <WH935> to him; And he did not delight <WH2654> in blessing, <WH1293> so it was far <WH7368> from him.
But he clothed <WH3847> himself with cursing <WH7045> as with his garment, <WH4055> And it entered <WH935> into his body <WH7130> like water, <WH4325> And like oil <WH8081> into his bones. <WH6106>
Let it be to him as a garment <WH899> with which he covers <WH5844> himself, And for a belt <WH9253> with which he constantly <WH8548> girds <WH2296> himself.
Let this <WH384> be the reward <WH6468> of my accusers <WH7853> from the Lord, <WH3068> And of those who speak <WH1696> evil <WH9563> against <WH5921> my soul. <WH5315>
But Thou, O God, <WH3068> the Lord, <WH136> deal <WH6213> [kindly] with me for Thy name's sake; <WH4616> Because <WH3588> Thy lovingkindness <WH2617> is good, <WH2896> deliver <WH5337> me;
For I am afflicted <WH6041> and needy, <WH34> And my heart <WH3820> is wounded <WH9135> within <WH7130> me.
I am passing <WH1980> like a shadow <WH6738> when it lengthens; <WH5186> I am shaken <WH5287> off <WH5287> like the locust. <WH697>
My knees <WH1290> are weak <WH3782> from fasting; <WH6685> And my flesh <WH1320> has grown <WH3584> lean, <WH3584> without <WH4480> fatness. <WH8081>
I also have become <WH1961> a reproach <WH2781> to them; When they see <WH7200> me, they wag <WH5128> their head. <WH7218>
Help <WH5826> me, O Lord <WH3068> my God; <WH430> Save <WH3467> me according to Thy lovingkindness. <WH2617>
And let them know <WH3045> that this <WH384> is Thy hand; <WH3027> Thou, Lord, <WH3068> hast done <WH6213> it.
Let them curse, <WH7043> but do Thou bless; <WH1288> When they arise, <WH6965> they shall be ashamed, <WH954> But Thy servant <WH5650> shall be glad. <WH8055>
Let my accusers <WH7853> be clothed <WH3847> with dishonor, <WH3639> And let them cover <WH5844> themselves with their own shame <WH1322> as with a robe. <WH4598>
With my mouth <WH6310> I will give <WH3034> thanks <WH3034> abundantly <WH3966> to the Lord; <WH3068> And in the midst <WH8432> of many <WH7227> I will praise <WH1984> Him.
For He stands <WH5975> at the right <WH3225> hand <WH3225> of the needy, <WH34> To save <WH3467> him from those who judge <WH8199> his soul. <WH5315>
